intro: Peucedanum gossweileri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh alpine conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a subtle, spicy scent when crushed. Peucedanum gossweileri plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
